title: How to Draw Objects Seen in Front View in Perspective (Graphic Software)

steps.headline: Open your software.
steps.description: This article is using MS Paint.

steps.headline: Make a room for those objects to be in.
To do that, first draw a square.
Then, make a dot in the middle of the square.
Next, draw a line from the dot to a corner of the square and beyond.
Now erase the part of the line that is in the square.
Repeat on the other corners.
steps.description: Now you have something that looks like a room.

steps.headline: Now, we will add a cube into the room.
Next,choose one of the top corners of the square, and draw a line to the dot.
Then, cut off the line a bit.
Now, do two other corners (you should be able to tell which corners to use, and how many).
Now you have created a cube.
steps.description: In this fashion, you can create many other things. Hope this helped!

text: Open your software. This article is using MS Paint. Make a room for those objects to be in.  To do that, first draw a square.  Then, make a dot in the middle of the square.  Next, draw a line from the dot to a corner of the square and beyond.  Now erase the part of the line that is in the square.  Repeat on the other corners. Now you have something that looks like a room. Now, we will add a cube into the room. Draw a small square. Now connect the lines.  Next,choose one of the top corners of the square, and draw a line to the dot.  Then, cut off the line a bit.  Now, do two other corners (you should be able to tell which corners to use, and how many).  Now you have created a cube. In this fashion, you can create many other things. Hope this helped!
